description: Twitter, Inc. was an American social media company based in San Francisco, California, which operated and was named for named for its flagship social media network prior to its rebrand as X.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_ADD_A_LIST_MEMBER
capabilities.description: Adds a user to a specified Twitter List; the list must be owned by the authenticated user.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_ADD_POST_TO_BOOKMARKS
capabilities.description: Adds a specified, existing, and accessible Tweet to a user's bookmarks, with success indicated by the 'bookmarked' field in the response.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_BOOKMARKS_BY_USER
capabilities.description: Retrieves Tweets bookmarked by the authenticated user, where the provided User ID must match the authenticated user's ID.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_CREATE_A_NEW_DM_CONVERSATION
capabilities.description: Creates a new group Direct Message (DM) conversation on Twitter with specified participant IDs and an initial message, which can include text and media attachments.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_CREATE_COMPLIANCE_JOB_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Creates a new compliance job to check the status of Tweet or user IDs; upload IDs as a plain text file (one ID per line) to the `upload_url` received in the response.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_CREATE_LIST
capabilities.description: Creates a new, empty List on X (formerly Twitter), for which the provided name must be unique for the authenticated user; accounts are added separately.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_CREATION_OF_A_POST
capabilities.description: Creates a Tweet on Twitter; `text` is required unless `card_uri`, `media_media_ids`, `poll_options`, or `quote_tweet_id` is provided. Example - Creating a tweet with media and location: { "text": "Check out our latest product update! ðŸš€", "media_media_ids": ["1455952740635586573"], "geo_place_id": "df51dec6f4ee2b2c" } Example - Quote tweet with commentary: { "text": "This is a game-changer for the industry! Here's why... ðŸ§µ", "quote_tweet_id": "1453828617121234945" } Example - Reply to a tweet: { "text": "Great point! Here's my take on this...", "reply_in_reply_to_tweet_id": "1453828617121234945" }

capabilities.name: TWITTER_DELETE_DM
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific Twitter Direct Message (DM) event using its `event_id` if the authenticated user sent it; this action is irreversible and does not delete entire conversations.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_DELETE_LIST
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specified Twitter List using its ID, which must be owned by the authenticated user; this action is irreversible and the list must already exist.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FETCH_LIST_MEMBERS_BY_ID
capabilities.description: Fetches members of a specific Twitter List, identified by its unique ID.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FETCH_SPACE_TICKET_BUYERS_LIST
capabilities.description: Retrieves a list of users who purchased tickets for a specific, valid, and ticketed Twitter Space.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FOLLOW_A_LIST
capabilities.description: Allows the authenticated user (`id`) to follow a specific Twitter List (`list_id`) they are permitted to access, subscribing them to the list's timeline; this does not automatically follow individual list members.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FOLLOWERS_BY_USER_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves a list of users who follow a specified public Twitter user ID.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FOLLOWING_BY_USER_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves users followed by a specific Twitter user, allowing pagination and customization of returned user and tweet data fields via expansions.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FOLLOW_USER
capabilities.description: Allows an authenticated user (path `id`) to follow another user (`target_user_id`), which results in a pending request if the target user's tweets are protected.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FULL_ARCHIVE_SEARCH
capabilities.description: Searches the full archive of public Tweets from March 2006 onwards; use 'start_time' and 'end_time' together for a defined time window.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_FULL_ARCHIVE_SEARCH_COUNTS
capabilities.description: Returns a count of Tweets from the full archive that match a specified query, aggregated by day, hour, or minute; `start_time` must be before `end_time` if both are provided, and `since_id`/`until_id` cannot be used with `start_time`/`end_time`.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_A_USER_S_LIST_MEMBERSHIPS
capabilities.description: Retrieves all Twitter Lists a specified user is a member of, including public Lists and private Lists the authenticated user is authorized to view.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_A_USER_S_OWNED_LISTS
capabilities.description: Call this action to retrieve Lists created (owned) by a specific Twitter user, not Lists they follow or are subscribed to.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_A_USER_S_PINNED_LISTS
capabilities.description: Retrieves the Lists a specific, existing Twitter user has pinned to their profile to highlight them.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_BLOCKED_USERS
capabilities.description: Retrieves user objects for accounts blocked by the specified user ID; this is a read-only view of a user's block list.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_DM_EVENTS_BY_ID
capabilities.description: Fetches a specific Direct Message (DM) event by its unique ID, allowing optional expansion of related data like users or tweets; ensure the `event_id` refers to an existing DM event accessible to the authenticated user.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_DM_EVENTS_FOR_A_DM_CONVERSATION
capabilities.description: Fetches Direct Message (DM) events for a one-on-one conversation with a specified participant ID, ordered chronologically newest to oldest; does not support group DMs.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_LIST_FOLLOWERS
capabilities.description: Fetches a list of users who follow a specific Twitter List, identified by its ID; ensure the authenticated user has access if the list is private.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_MEDIA_UPLOAD_STATUS
capabilities.description: Get the status of a media upload for X/Twitter. Use this to check the processing status of uploaded media, especially for videos and GIFs. Only needed if the FINALIZE command returned processing_info.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_MUTED_USERS
capabilities.description: Returns user objects muted by the X user identified by the `id` path parameter.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_POST_RETWEETERS_ACTION
capabilities.description: Retrieves users who publicly retweeted a specified public Post ID, excluding Quote Tweets and retweets from private accounts.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_RECENT_DM_EVENTS
capabilities.description: Returns recent Direct Message events for the authenticated user, such as new messages or changes in conversation participants.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_GET_USER_S_FOLLOWED_LISTS
capabilities.description: Returns metadata (not Tweets) for lists a specific Twitter user follows, optionally including expanded owner details.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_HIDE_REPLIES
capabilities.description: Hides or unhides an existing reply Tweet.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_LIST_LOOKUP_BY_LIST_ID
capabilities.description: Returns metadata for a specific Twitter List, identified by its ID; does not return list members but can expand the owner's User object via the `expansions` parameter.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_LIST_POST_LIKERS
capabilities.description: Retrieves users who have liked the Post (Tweet) identified by the provided ID.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_LIST_POSTS_TIMELINE_BY_LIST_ID
capabilities.description: Fetches the most recent Tweets posted by members of a specified Twitter List.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_MUTE_USER_BY_USER_ID
capabilities.description: Mutes a target user on behalf of an authenticated user, preventing the target's Tweets and Retweets from appearing in the authenticated user's home timeline without notifying the target.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_PIN_A_LIST
capabilities.description: Pins a specified List to the authenticated user's profile, provided the List exists, the user has access rights, and the pin limit (typically 5 Lists) is not exceeded.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_POST_DELETE_BY_POST_ID
capabilities.description: Irreversibly deletes a specific Tweet by its ID; the Tweet may persist in third-party caches after deletion.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_POST_LOOKUP_BY_POST_ID
capabilities.description: Fetches comprehensive details for a single Tweet by its unique ID, provided the Tweet exists and is accessible.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_POST_LOOKUP_BY_POST_IDS
capabilities.description: Retrieves detailed information for one or more Posts (Tweets) identified by their unique IDs, allowing selection of specific fields and expansions.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_POSTS_LABEL_STREAM
capabilities.description: Establishes a persistent stream of real-time events for when Tweet labels are applied or removed, offering insights into content categorization.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_POST_USAGE
capabilities.description: Fetches Tweet usage statistics for a Project (e.g., consumption, caps, daily breakdowns for Project & Client Apps) to monitor API limits; data can be retrieved for 1 to 90 days.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RECENT_SEARCH
capabilities.description: Searches Tweets from the last 7 days matching a query (using X's search syntax), ideal for real-time analysis, trend monitoring, or retrieving posts from specific users (e.g., `from:username`) Example - Get original tweets from Elon Musk since Sept 20, 2025: { "query": "from:elonmusk -is:retweet -is:reply", "start_time": "2025-09-20T00:00:00Z", "max_results": 50, "tweet_fields": ["created_at","public_metrics","text"], "expansions": ["author_id","attachments.media_keys","referenced_tweets.id"] }

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RECENT_SEARCH_COUNTS
capabilities.description: Retrieves the count of Tweets matching a specified search query within the last 7 days, aggregated by 'minute', 'hour', or 'day'.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_REMOVE_A_BOOKMARKED_POST
capabilities.description: Removes a Tweet, specified by `tweet_id`, from the authenticated user's bookmarks; the Tweet must have been previously bookmarked by the user for the action to have an effect.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_REMOVE_A_LIST_MEMBER
capabilities.description: Removes a user from a Twitter List; the response `is_member` field will be `false` if removal was successful or the user was not a member, and the updated list of members is not returned.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETRIEVE_COMPLIANCE_JOB_BY_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves status, download/upload URLs, and other details for an existing Twitter compliance job specified by its unique ID.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETRIEVE_COMPLIANCE_JOBS
capabilities.description: Returns a list of recent compliance jobs, filtered by type (tweets or users) and optionally by status.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETRIEVE_DM_CONVERSATION_EVENTS
capabilities.description: Retrieves Direct Message (DM) events for a specific conversation ID on Twitter, useful for analyzing messages and participant activities.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETRIEVE_POSTS_FROM_A_SPACE
capabilities.description: Retrieves Tweets from a specified Twitter Space ID; the Space must be accessible and results are batched (not streamed).

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETRIEVE_POSTS_THAT_QUOTE_A_POST
capabilities.description: Retrieves Tweets that quote a specified Tweet, requiring a valid Tweet ID.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETRIEVE_POSTS_THAT_REPOST_A_POST
capabilities.description: Retrieves Tweets that Retweeted a specified public or authenticated-user-accessible Tweet ID, optionally customizing the response with fields and expansions.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETURNS_POST_OBJECTS_LIKED_BY_THE_PROVIDED_USER_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves Tweets liked by a specified Twitter user, provided their liked tweets are public or accessible.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETURNS_THE_OPEN_API_SPECIFICATION_DOCUMENT
capabilities.description: Fetches the OpenAPI specification (JSON) for Twitter's API v2, used to programmatically understand the API's structure for developing client libraries or tools.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_RETWEET_POST
capabilities.description: Retweets a Tweet (`tweet_id`) for a given user (`id`), provided the Tweet is public (or user follows if protected), not already retweeted by the user, and its author has not blocked the user.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_SEARCH_FOR_SPACES
capabilities.description: Searches for Twitter Spaces by a textual query, optionally filtering by state (live, scheduled, all) to discover audio conversations.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_SEND_A_NEW_MESSAGE_TO_A_DM_CONVERSATION
capabilities.description: Sends a message, with optional text and/or media attachments (using pre-uploaded `media_id`s), to a specified Twitter Direct Message conversation.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_SEND_A_NEW_MESSAGE_TO_A_USER
capabilities.description: Sends a new Direct Message with text and/or media (media_id for attachments must be pre-uploaded) to a specified Twitter user; this creates a new DM and does not modify existing messages.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_SPACE_LOOKUP_BY_SPACE_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves details for a Twitter Space by its ID, allowing for customization and expansion of related data, provided the Space ID is valid and accessible.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_SPACE_LOOKUP_BY_THEIR_CREATORS
capabilities.description: Retrieves Twitter Spaces created by a list of specified User IDs, with options to customize returned data fields.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_SPACE_LOOKUP_UP_SPACE_IDS
capabilities.description: Fetches detailed information for one or more Twitter Spaces (live, scheduled, or ended) by their unique IDs; at least one Space ID must be provided.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UNFOLLOW_A_LIST
capabilities.description: Enables a user (via `id`) to unfollow a specific Twitter List (via `list_id`), which removes its tweets from their timeline and stops related notifications; the action reports `following: false` on success, even if the user was not initially following the list.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UNFOLLOW_USER
capabilities.description: Allows the authenticated `source_user_id` to unfollow an existing Twitter user (`target_user_id`), which removes the follow relationship.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UNLIKE_POST
capabilities.description: Allows an authenticated user (`id`) to remove their like from a specific post (`tweet_id`); the action is idempotent and completes successfully even if the post was not liked.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UNMUTE_USER_BY_USER_ID
capabilities.description: Unmutes a `target_user_id` for the `source_user_id` (authenticated user), allowing the source user to see Tweets and notifications from the target user again.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UNPIN_A_LIST
capabilities.description: Unpins a List (specified by list_id) from a user's profile (specified by id), provided the List is currently pinned by that user.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UNRETWEET_POST
capabilities.description: Removes a user's retweet of a specified Post, if the user had previously retweeted it.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UPDATE_LIST
capabilities.description: Updates an existing Twitter List's name, description, or privacy status, requiring the List ID and at least one mutable property.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UPLOAD_LARGE_MEDIA
capabilities.description: Use this to upload GIFs/videos and for any file larger than 5 MB to X/Twitter.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_UPLOAD_MEDIA
capabilities.description: Upload media (images, GIFs, videos) to X/Twitter using the v2 API. Use 'Upload Large Media' for GIFs/videos or any file larger than ~5 MiB; this action is intended for small images and small files only.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_HOME_TIMELINE_BY_USER_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves the home timeline/feed for a specified Twitter user, showing Tweets from accounts they follow - not their own posts - in reverse chronological order; useful for displaying their personalized feed without algorithmic sorting.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_LIKE_POST
capabilities.description: Allows the authenticated user (`id`) to like a specific, accessible Tweet (`tweet_id`), provided neither user has blocked the other and the authenticated user is not restricted from liking.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_LOOKUP_BY_ID
capabilities.description: Retrieves detailed public information for a Twitter user by their ID, optionally expanding related data (e.g., pinned tweets) and specifying particular user or tweet fields to return.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_LOOKUP_BY_IDS
capabilities.description: Retrieves detailed information for specified X (formerly Twitter) user IDs, optionally customizing returned fields and expanding related entities.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_LOOKUP_BY_USERNAME
capabilities.description: Fetches public profile information for a valid and existing Twitter user by their username, optionally expanding related data like pinned Tweets; results may be limited for protected profiles not followed by the authenticated user.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_LOOKUP_BY_USERNAMES
capabilities.description: Retrieves detailed information for 1 to 100 Twitter users by their usernames (each 1-15 alphanumeric characters/underscores), allowing customizable user/tweet fields and expansion of related data like pinned tweets.

capabilities.name: TWITTER_USER_LOOKUP_ME
capabilities.description: Returns profile information for the currently authenticated X user, customizable via request fields.
